job.title: Encroachment/Right of Way Inspector
job.description:
We are currently seeking an&nbsp;Encroachment/ROW Inspector&nbsp;to join our team.&nbsp;The ideal candidate would be familiar with Utility Vegetation Management, enjoys a mix of work from home and fieldwork, is a self-starter, and values the freedom of working independently.&nbsp;If you enjoy a fast-paced environment and the challenges of a rewarding profession, consider a career with ECI.&nbsp;&nbsp;This role typically requires 75% work from home and 25% fieldwork but is subject to change based on work requirements on any given day.During these uncertain times, you can take pride in knowing you are an&nbsp;essential&nbsp;employee. Our team members work independently and follow all CDC recommended guidelines and company safety protocols relevant to COVID-19.Some of the most important characteristics of&nbsp;ECI&nbsp;Encroachment/ROW Inspector&nbsp;is that you are open-minded and able to engage in safe, constructive interactions with the public. You are accountable for advancing a culture of safety and excellence while providing quality and value to our customers and clients.   WHAT WE OFFER:  - Industry competitive pay.   
  - Company vehicle with a fuel card to take to and from home & work.   
  - Medical/Health/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance, effective Day 1 for full-time team members.   
  - 401K eligibility.   
  - Paid Holidays, Vacation, and Sick Leave.   
  - Weekly paychecks and direct deposit.   
  - Participation in Employee Referral Program (must meet eligibility requirements).   
  - Boot and clothing program (company-funded).   
  - Ongoing training and assistance with obtaining industry certifications.   
   WHAT YOU WILL DO:  - Resolve encroachment issues by building trust with landowners and internal stakeholders.   
  - Manage one or more concurrent projects spread across different geographical locations.   
  - Read and interpret transmission construction engineering plans.   
  - Negotiate landowner encroachment agreements.   
  - Maintain detailed records.   
  - Execute memorandum of understanding (MoU) with landowners.   
  - Communicate daily with the utility client, contractors, landowners, and the general public.   
  - Perform duties in a manner that will promote and maintain good public relations and work safety practices.   
  - Assume other duties and responsibilities as assigned.   
&nbsp;WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE:  - Ability to understand and interpret engineering plans.   
  - Strong negotiation skills are a must.   
  - Must be able to work alone, outdoors in various weather conditions and terrain.   
  - Must have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, strong problem solving and multi-tasking abilities, and demonstrated attention to detail.   
  - Must be able to adapt to change.   
  - Must have basic computer skills.   
&nbsp;WHAT WOULD BE AMAZING TO HAVE:  - A degree in Forestry, Engineering, or related field is a plus.   
  - Prior utility or utility vegetation management (UVM) or related fieldwork experience is a plus.   
  - Previous project management experience is desired.   
  - ISA Arborist Certification preferred   
  - &nbsp;Bi-Lingual (Spanish) is a plus.   
&nbsp;PhysicalFieldwork can require extended periods of time driving to the worksite and accessing encroachments and/or property owner residences.&nbsp;Company OverviewEnvironmental Consultants (ECI) is a leading provider of vegetation and asset management consulting services to the utility industry. Successful professionals at ECI have come from a variety of backgrounds, including: forestry, arboriculture, natural resource management, biology, landscape maintenance, horticulture, nursery management, environmental sciences, geology, agriculture, parks & recreation management, urban forestry, geography, and more.&nbsp;ECI offers exciting career opportunities with an excellent compensation package and ongoing growth potential.Applicants must pass a pre-employment drug test and a criminal background check.All candidates must possess a valid driver's license and have a good driving record.ECI is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. EOE/AA : Minority/Female/ Vets/ Disabled.
